availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Native of Kentucky. Born to a wealthy, slaveholding father, Joseph M Collins was privately educated and became a teacher in Grant County at 18.In 1855, he moved to Missouri to work as a merchant and ran for a legislative seat as an independent candidate unsuccessfully. He returned to northern Kentucky and studied law in 1858. Joseph M. Collins worked as a lawyer and owned two slaves in 1860.

Spouse: Mary J. Collins (Craig)
Children: Albert C. Collins

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Grant County, Crittenden, page 191.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Grant County, page 6.
U.S. Find a Grave Index, 1600-Present, Joseph M Collins, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=93643345&ref=acom accessed 03/03/2017.
